file_content.text: Your troops will fight in Gorma-Koss. The Republic is welcome here.
Peace with the Gormak will take time. We have none left for outsiders.
You return from the Nightmare Lands. We will waste no time.
The Three wish to hear your report directly. I will contact them.
This is a great honor for the Republic. I hope you've brought good news.
Sonn-Vi. Gunta-Mer. Nen-Ji. The Three.
Outsiders. We have followed your path on Voss.
So you are the outsider the Mystics saw.
You exposed Lord Beldiss. You completed the Mystic's trials.
You defeated Jokull. We did not expect so much.
The Gormak consider us Voss, too. They're a threat to us both.
We're all in this together.
You speak the truth. We hope you know more.
Just doing my job.
Your service to the Voss is almost complete.
Maybe you'll think better of outsiders in the future.
You should work on that.
You have not saved us yet.
Jokull saw the future. Another Gormak visionary could bring our destruction. This cannot be allowed.
You walked Jokull's path. Tell us--how did the Gormak king receive his visions?
Gormak are also capable of having visions. You're one people that split centuries ago.
The Gormak and Voss are one.
You're fighting a civil war that's corrupting all of Voss. You'll destroy yourselves. You have to make peace.
Impossible! Unthinkable!
You link us to all that is horror.
The Gormak have waged war on the Voss for centuries. Do you realize what you're asking?
You wanted the war to end. You can end it without fighting.
I'm asking for peace.
The Gormak are not Voss. They do not understand peace.
Unless you stop fighting, the darkness this war has created will consume Voss.
I'm thinking of the future.
The darkness has always been. Nothing will change.
You'll destroy your own people if you keep fighting.
This war's not worth it.
The Gormak are mindless corruption. How can they be Voss?
Stop killing the Gormak. Doesn't seem hard.
Something pretty easy.
Speak these lies to the Gormak. You will not survive long.
I'm only telling the truth.
So you claim.
Accept the truth, or let Voss be destroyed.
You don't have much choice.
The Gormak will destroy us first.
You forget the Mystic's vision. An outsider will end the Gormak threat.
By sharing this truth, the Gormak become Voss. A threat no longer.
All else has happened as seen. We cannot deny a Mystic's vision.
Then it is possible. The Gormak may be our brothers. Everything must change.
I know the truth is hard to accept, but this is what's best for Voss.
This is the right decision.
We do what is necessary.
You have friends here.
You braved the Dark Heart. That is enough.
These changes won't affect any outsiders, will they?
That doesn't sound good.
A Voss does not kill a Voss. All action against the Gormak will be suspended. If we can make them understand.
You ask us to join your war. The Voss cannot aid you now.
We understand. The Republic only wishes you the best of luck in your efforts.
There is much to be done. We take our leave.
You put the Voss before your own. This could not have been easy.
I couldn't let the Voss destroy themselves.
I had no choice.
Few outsiders show such concern.
I had no right to tell the Voss anything but the truth.
I can't change history.
You could have lied. You did not.
The Republic will get by. The Voss need to act now.
Don't worry about us.
If this is truth... the Gormak will be hard to convince.
You asked for the truth, and you got it.
I have no regrets.
It is... difficult to accept.
Peace with the Gormak won't be easy.
I just hope they listen.
We will do what we must.
You can say that again.
There's no chance of a Republic alliance, but there's no chance of an Imperial one either. All things considered, we did well.
The Republic has done much for Voss. This will be remembered.
Your part in this has ended, outsider. You have our thanks.
Jokull entered the den of an ancient darkness known as Sel-Makor. Sel-Makor can control any creature in the Nightmare Lands.
[Lie] It was the darkness.
One of these creatures gave Jokull his visions. I fought the creature and killed it. No Gormak will ever have visions again.
It is as we had hoped. You ease our fears, outsider.
Jokull entered the Nightmare Lands unseen. He returned with a power he should never have had.
We have tolerated the Gormak for too long. It cannot continue.
I'm sure Ambassador Jannik knows where to find some allies.
The Republic can help you.
How will you stop them?
We will fight harder. All commandos will be sent to Gorma-Koss.
I'm not fighting a war for you.
That's your problem now.
You've done your part. Let the Republic do the rest.
We can give you troops, ships, supplies... military support is just one of the benefits of an alliance with the Republic.
This fight is not yours, yet you offer us aid. We will consider an alliance.
There is much to be done. You have our thanks.
When you landed, we could hardly get an audience with the Voss. Now we're close to an alliance. I can't believe it.
You have shown us how to defeat the Gormak. You will be honored.
Thank you for deeming me worthy to defend Voss.
The honor was mine.
The Mystics saw an outsider. The Three chose well.
Experiencing Voss culture was reward enough.
I enjoyed my time here.
You showed respect.
I'm looking forward to fighting alongside Voss commandos.
An alliance is honor enough.
Together, we will end the Gormak threat.
Kind of hard to spend honor, if you get what I mean.
Are we talking credits?
If that is what you value.
Don't mention it.
I like the sound of that.
You prove outsiders can be trusted.
An outsider will end the Gormak threat. The Mystic's vision has come to pass.
You are a friend of the Voss. Go well.
Enter the Dark Heart. We must know the truth.
The outsiders return.
Outsider. You have returned.
This matter must be settled in Voss-Ka. Ambassador Jannik remains at his post.
I've been following the developments in Gorma-Koss. You've done the Republic proud.
The Gormak cannon is silent. Voss-Ka is safe. We are grateful.
Are you aware the Gormak king is having visions?
And what about Jokull?
All in a day's work.
Ambassador Jannik chose well.
If I'd left it to the Voss commandos, your city would be in ruins.
Someone had to step up.
We know nothing of Gormak abominations. Perhaps outsiders do.
Rade-Sa sent word of the assault. His report was... disturbing.
Jokull's been imprisoned as far from the Voss as possible. Apparently, he's here on your orders.
Jokull should not be here. He is not Voss.
We must know about his visions. He can't answer if he's dead.
You need him alive.
His words bring discontent.
With all due respect, he is not what you think of the Gormak either.
That's not a crime.
He is an abomination.
I'm an outsider. Visions are your department.
Well, neither am I.
We prefer to judge from afar.
Shouldn't have assumed visionaries would be interested in a vision.
My mistake, I guess.
You have left us no choice.
If you find him that offensive, get rid of him.
I won't do your dirty work.
The Step of Harmony has been considered.
The Mystics are meditating on what happened. The rest of Voss-Ka only knows that you fought the Gormak king and won.
Jokull is dead. You spared Voss-Ka.
He refused to surrender. I did what I had to.
He chose his own fate.
You did well.
Jokull was your greatest enemy. To spare him would be an insult.
I respect your culture.
His visions are insult enough.
Jokull almost destroyed Voss-Ka.
He was too dangerous.
He was unlike other Gormak.
I got the feeling you wouldn't like it if he survived.
Glad I chose right.
His presence here is unthinkable.
Jokull knew things he shouldn't have.
What about his vision?
Rade-Sa and the others were too afraid to do anything else.
It wasn't my decision.
You cannot understand our shame.
Jokull might have known the commandos wouldn't reach you. He couldn't have known they would contact Rade-Sa.
The Mystics agree. Jokull was having visions.
Visions would explain the Gormak's military strides since Jokull took over.
Jokull would use his sight to destroy all Voss. The visions must end.
The Mystics have been seeing the future a lot longer than Jokull.
You have visions, too.
The Mystics can only see. The Gormak are warriors.
The Gormak have an edge. What do we do about it?
What happens now?
Visions didn't save Jokull from being defeated.
Jokull's no threat.
If one Gormak can see, more may follow.
Jokull said his visions began after a trip to the Nightmare Lands. Whatever caused them must be down there, too.
Enter the Nightmare Lands. Follow Jokull's path. Destroy the source.
No matter what Jokull faced, I will stop it.
I won't fail you.
There must be a way.
First, we must learn why Jokull received his visions.
When the time comes.
Voss lives are at stake. Do not hesitate.
Whatever's handing out visions down there, I'll find it.
Understood.
It may find you first.
If it's something I can blast, you've got nothing to worry about.
I'll do my best.
You will face other challenges.
What can I expect?
I'm not on Voss to chase after a Gormak mutant.
I didn't sign up for this.
You are part of a vision. We do what is necessary.
The Nightmare Lands are a place of darkness. Most go mad.
Talan-De reports that you've completed the Mystic's ritual and are safe from madness, if nothing else.
It's the "nothing else" that worries me.
That's not very comforting.
The Dark Heart holds ancient secrets. We have no guidance.
The Mystics have a ritual to protect themselves. You'll need to complete it in order to reach the Dark Heart.
What does this Mystic ritual involve?
I want to do it right.
You will face madness. You will be cleansed.
Where do I start?
I don't need rituals.
The Nightmare Lands affect all.
Talan-De will guide you. Find him at the landing site.
The Gormak must be defeated. You will return.
You will defeat the Gormak. Do what is necessary.
I speak for the Three. Outsiders do not belong here.
